result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel G Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gabriel G Ramirez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gabriel G Ramirez was found guilty of Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).
  • Gabriel G Ramirez was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 14CF2286.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$528  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with NN, TN or family.
1st 6 mo have home sobrietor and be required to use it.   Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

supervisions.notes: $243  to be paid as a condition of Extended supervision in ct 1.
$164.50 Civil filing fee pursuant to sec. 814.61(1)(d) & (e) and $40 service fee pursuant to sec. 814.70(1) from case 13CV435.
Consec to ct 1 & 14CF2286.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that this court will take no action on Mr. Ramirez's request to issue a ruling only on his Rhines motion; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that by December 5, 2022, petitioner-appellant, Gabriel G. Ramirez, shall file, with the clerk of this court, a statement in support of petition for review conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4). The petition shall set forth the reasons why this court should review the court of appeals' June 7, 2022 order. If the statement is not filed by that time, the petition will be summarily dismissed.
Defendant's Motion for Court to Respond to His Postconviction Relief and Request for an Evidentiary Hearing

IT IS ORDERED that the motion for an extension of time to pay costs and fees is granted. Defendant-appellant, Gabriel G. Ramirez, shall have until October 14, 2022 to either pay the filing fee or submit the correct prisoner's petition for waiver of fees/costs-affidavit of indigency as well as a certified copy of his prisoner's trust fund account for the last six months.

IT IS ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by December 5, 2022. If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.
Supplemental Addendum Motion to Def's Filed motion to Def's motion for postconviction relief pursuant to Wis Stats 809.30, 974.06 and 973.10
Pursuant to Wis Stats 809.30, 974.06 and 973.10 (def's)

IT IS ORDERED that the motion for waiver of the required number of copies is granted. Defendant-appellant, Gabriel G. Ramirez, shall file one copy of the petition for review and appendix as well as send one copy of each to the opposing counsel of record.
from Chief Judge to Defn in response to motion filed on 6/13/22

Zoom

Defendant in court via video, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional.  Erin Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video. Atty Ben Wagner appeared via video. Motion Hearing  held remotely through Zoom due to COVID-19 Health Pandemic.  Public viewing access available through YouTube Live. Atty Wagner filed a motion to withdraw as counsel. State filed a response brief objecting to the motion to withdraw. Colloquy w/ defn. Defn does not wish counsel withdraw; statement by Defn. Argument by Atty Wagner. CT makes findings and denies motion to allow Atty Wagner to w/d. CT orders a briefing schedule. Atty Wagner and ADA Hanson to submit simultaneous briefs no later than 12/18/2020.
Motion hearing on November 9, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in court via video, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional.  Erin Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video. Atty Benjamin Wagner appeared via video. Motion on postconviction relief hearing held remotely through Zoom due to COVID-19 Health Pandemic. Public viewing access available through YouTube Live. Motion hearing cont. from 8/17/2020. CT finds waiver of atty/client privilege still applies. Witness Atty. Reed Cornia duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA Hanson. Defn and Atty Wagner move to break out room for a private converstaion. Cross exam by Atty Wagner. Witness excused at 3:52 pm. State moves exhibits 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15. CT receives exhibits w/o obj. Cross exam by Atty Wagner. Redirect exam by ADA Hanson. CT directs counsel to submit their own findings of fact they think the CT needs to reach. Atty Wagner to contact clerk if requesting another hearing to present additional evidence by 9/25.

Attorney Reed Cornia in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reed Cornia in court for Defendant Gabriel G Ramirez. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Leave on for trial.
Status conference on September 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Reed Cornia.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gabriel G Ramirez in court with attorney Reed Cornia. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Previously defendant may have wanted to enter a NGI plea but after discussion with Atty Cornia has decided not to enter a NGI plea.  Atty Cornia indicates cases should be set for trial. Ct enters not guilty plea on all cases. ADA Sattler indicates that previously Atty Gonzalez (previous counsel) and ADA Sattler agreed to join cases 14CF2286 & 15CF518 but 15CF1280 will be tried seperately. Atty Cornia does not object to joiner.  Ct. orders 14CF2286 & 15CF518 joined for trial.  15CF1280 will remain seperate. Parties request 4 days for trial.  Bail continues.
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Reed Cornia.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gabriel G Ramirez in court with attorney Reed Cornia. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA Sattler requests that defn's pro se motions to be addressed. Atty Cornia requests 60 days to take care of NGI plea.  Ct rules that defn will have report for NGI plea on 3-14-2016.  Ct instructs Atty Cornia to obtain file and motions from previous counsel. State has until 4-29-2016 to repsond to NGI report. Ct. rules that ct. will nto hear or rule on any motions defn. filed pro se because defendant was actually represented by an attorney at that time.

on Surety's request to return cash bail which was posted; State took no position; Defendant agreed that money could be returned to Surety; Court granted request and ordered cash bond be returned to Surety; Atty Gonzalez moved to withdraw as counsel; Defendant stated he did not want Atty Gonzalez to withdraw; Atty Gonzalez took no position but stated he felt he could no longer represent the Defendant due to possible appellate issues if he remained on the case; Court ordered Atty Gonzalez to withdraw as counsel and ordered successor counsel be appointed; Atty Gonzalez updated the Court as to the NGI report of Dr. Spierer; Court will set case for a status conference upon appointment of successor counsel
